sections.body:
Welcome to Learning Hiragana Japanese Characters.

Basic Vowels.  Japanese has 5 basic vowels:
あ - a - pronounced "ah", like the vowel in "car"
い - i - pronounced "ee", like "bee" or "key"
 う - u - pronounced "u", like in "moo" or "tube"
え - e - pronounced "eh", like in "end" or "bet"
お - o - pronounced "oh", like in "joe" or "go"


あい (ai) is the Japanese word for "love".

sections.prompt:
Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

あ

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

い

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

う

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

え

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

お

sections.body:
Consonant sounds are combined with the basic vowels to make more characters.

"K" characters:
か - ka - pronounced "kah"
き - ki - pronounced "key"
く - ku - pronounced "coo"
け - ke - as in "okay"
こ - ko - as in "coal"

かく (kaku) is the Japanese word for "write"

sections.prompt:
Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

か

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

き

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

く

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

け

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

こ

sections.body:
"S" characters:
さ - sa - pronounced "saw"
し - shi - pronounced "she"
す - su - pronounced "sue"
せ - se - pronounced "say"
そ - so - pronounced "sew"

すし (sushi) is a popular Japanese food

Be careful - "s" and "i" sounds are combined to make "shi" NOT "si"

さ

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

す

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

そ

sections.body:
"T" characters:
た - ta - like the begining of "talk"
ち - chi - like in "cheetah"
つ - tsu - like the begining of "tsunami"
て - te - like in "take"
と - to - pronounced "toe"

てつ (tetsu) is the Japanese word for iron.

Be careful - "t" and "i" sounds are combined to make "chi" NOT "ti"

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

sections.body:
"N" characters:
な - na - like the begining of "not"
に - ni - like "knee"
ぬ - nu - pronounced "new"
ね - ne - like in "nape"
の - no - pronounced "no"

なに (nani) is the Japanese word for "what".

ぬ - nu - pronounced "new"
ね - ne - like in "nape"

なに (nani) is the Japanese word for "what".

sections.body:
"H" characters:
は - ha - like in "hawk"
ひ - hi - like "heat"
ふ - hu - pronounced "who"
へ - he - like in "head"
ほ - ho - pronounced "hoe"

はい (hai) is the Japanese word for "yes".

sections.body:
"M" characters:
ま - ma - like the end of "grandma"
み - mi - like "me"
む - mu - pronounced "moo"
め - me - pronounced "may"
も - mo - pronounced "mow"

もも (momo) is the Japanese word for "peach".

sections.body:
"Y" characters:
や - ya - like in "yawn"
ゆ - yu - pronounced "you"
よ - yo - like in "yolk"

ゆき (yuki) is the Japanese word for "snow".

sections.body:
"R" characters:
ら - ra - like in "rock"
り - ri - like "return"
る - ru - pronounced "rue"
れ - re - pronounced "ray"
ろ - ro - pronounced "row"

ろく (roku) is the Japanese word for "six".

sections.body:
"W" characters:
わ - wa - like in "walk"
を - wo - pronounced "oh"

Note that the 'w' on を(wo) is not pronounced.
